description: The airport of the Tontatta Kingdom located beneath Green Bit, featuring rideable insects and animals as transport. This underground facility serves as the departure point for the dwarves' operations.
geography: An underground airport within the Tontatta Kingdom, connected to Green Bit and Dressrosa via subterranean passages.

keyEvents.description: Leo brings Usopp and Robin to the Tontatta Airline, where they witness the dwarves' unique insect-based transportation system.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the secret infrastructure that will allow the dwarves to infiltrate Dressrosa for their rebellion.

keyEvents.description: Kabu demonstrates his Rhinoceros Beetle transformation at the airline to prepare for flight.
keyEvents.significance: First display of the Tontatta's Devil Fruit-powered transportation capabilities.

keyEvents.description: Bian reveals her Hornet transformation at the airline.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the variety of insect-based powers among the Tontatta warriors.

name.japanese: ドレスローザのひまわり畑

description: A field of sunflowers in Dressrosa that conceals the underground headquarters of the Riku Royal Army (Anti-Doflamingo Army). The Thunder Soldier uses this location to organize the rebellion with the dwarves and Franky.
geography: A sunflower field on the surface with underground chambers beneath serving as the rebellion's base of operations.

keyEvents.description: Thunder Soldier introduces Franky to the dwarf army beneath the sunflower field, forming the alliance that will become the Riku Royal Army.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the hidden headquarters of the rebellion and the alliance between toys, dwarves, and the Straw Hats.

description: The underground kingdom of the Tontatta dwarf tribe located beneath Green Bit. Home to a peaceful but exploited people with a 900-year history of conflict with the Donquixote Family.
geography: An underground kingdom beneath Green Bit island with subterranean passages connecting to Dressrosa.

keyEvents.description: Gancho, the king of the Tontatta Kingdom, meets with Usopp and Robin.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the leadership of the kingdom and sets up the major revelation about their history.

keyEvents.description: Gancho reveals the 900-year history of exploitation and conflict between the Tontatta and the Donquixote Family dating back to the Void Century.
keyEvents.significance: Connects the kingdom's history to the Void Century and reveals the deep roots of the current conflict.

keyEvents.description: The dwarves of the Tontatta Kingdom prepare for Operation SOP to rescue their 500 captured comrades.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the kingdom mobilizing for war and their determination to end their oppression.

statusHistory.notes: Kingdom exists in hiding with 500 dwarves held captive by Doflamingo

description: An uninhabited island north of Dressrosa, connected by a bridge and home to the underground Tontatta Kingdom. The surface appears wild and dangerous with fighting fish in the surrounding waters.
geography: A forested island with an underground kingdom beneath it, connected to Dressrosa by a bridge.

keyEvents.description: Doflamingo confronts Law on the surface of Green Bit, revealing his trap and demanding Caesar's heart.
keyEvents.significance: Green Bit becomes the battleground for the critical confrontation between Doflamingo and Law.
